exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a wide grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Offers a big stretch on your lats, provides smooth even tension throughout the range of motion, feels great, and allows for easy overload by increasing the pin weight.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both the lats and mid traps due to the wide grip and pulling motion.
exercises.selection_reason: The Wide Grip Lat Pull Down is selected for its ability to increase the width of the back by targeting the lats and mid traps. Its wide grip emphasizes the lats, aligning with the user's goal to increase back width. It's suitable for beginners due to its stable setup and controlled movement.

exercises.exercise_name: Half Kneeling One Arm Lat Pull Down
exercises.setup_notes: Kneel on one knee and brace against a bench or your knee for stability.
exercises.execution_notes: Pull the cable down with one arm, focusing on driving the elbow down, and return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High stretch, high tension, good feel, and easy to overload. Allows focus on one lat at a time to prevent asymmetries.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets the lats with a focus on unilateral development.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is chosen for its unilateral focus, which helps in correcting any muscle imbalances. It provides a high stretch and tension on the lats, contributing to the user's goal of increasing back width. It's beginner-friendly due to its controlled movement and focus on one side at a time.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
exercises.execution_notes: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down and maintaining high tension in the stretched position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High tension in stretched position, locks elbows to prevent cheating, significant distal biceps growth.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Distal biceps, due to high tension in stretched position.
exercises.scientific_insights: Study shows preacher curls cause more distal biceps growth compared to incline curls.
exercises.selection_reason: Preacher Curl is selected for its ability to enhance the peak of the biceps by focusing on the distal part. It provides high tension in the stretched position, which is crucial for muscle growth, aligning with the user's goal for biceps peak development. It's suitable for beginners due to its stable setup.

exercises.setup_notes: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
exercises.tier_reasons: Maximum stretch and tension on biceps, even tension throughout range.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to high stretch and tension.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is chosen for its ability to provide maximum stretch and tension on the biceps, particularly the long head, which contributes to the biceps peak. It aligns with the user's goal for biceps peak development and is suitable for beginners due to its controlled movement.

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow).
Swing arms forward and backward in a controlled manner.
